attributes.additional_details: The Mayor decision is against Christians coming to worship in Churches, in the City of London - Churches are suffering due to lack of attendance and needs urgent help once the social distance rule is abandoned.
attributes.background: The City churches are open on Sundays and the additional £15.00 Congestion Charge is an extra cost for disabled who cannot travel by public transport and need the use of car in addition to the cost of fuel and parking charge - This is an revenue through the back door and not a 'Green' agenda.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the London Assembly.
You can petition the London Assembly directly: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Prevent local authorities imposing congestion charges outside 6am-7pm Mon-Fri: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330925
